meanings.definition: The act of guiding or moving a group of animals in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The herdings of the sheep were done carefully by the shepherd.
meanings.sent2: The rancher used a trained dog to manage the herdings of the cattle.
meanings.sent3: The herdings of the ducks seemed like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent4: The herdings of the horses resembled a flowing river of strength.
meanings.sent5: The herdings of the pigs left a trail of mud and mischief behind.

meanings.definition: A group of animals that are being guided or moved together.
meanings.sent1: The herdings of geese flew gracefully across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The herdings of wildebeests migrated across the vast savanna.
meanings.sent3: The herdings of rabbits hopped in unison, creating a cute spectacle.
meanings.sent4: The herdings of fish swam in perfect harmony, shimmering like silver.
meanings.sent5: The herdings of elephants trumpeted loudly as they moved through the jungle.
